title: harmony_leiden
description: Run harmony integration followed by neighbour calculations, leiden clustering and run umap on the result.

layer.description: use specified layer for expression values instead of the .X object from the modality.

uns_neighbors.description: In which .uns slot to store various neighbor output objects.

obsp_neighbor_distances.description: In which .obsp slot to store the distance matrix between the resulting neighbors.

obsp_neighbor_connectivities.description: In which .obsp slot to store the connectivities matrix between the resulting neighbors.

obsm_integrated.description: In which .obsm slot to store the resulting integrated embedding.

obs_covariates.description: The .obs field(s) that define the covariate(s) to regress out.

rna_theta.description: Diversity clustering penalty parameter. Specify for each variable in group.by.vars.
rna_theta.help_text:
Diversity clustering penalty parameter. Specify for each variable in group.by.vars. 
theta=0 does not encourage any diversity. Larger values of theta
result in more diverse clusters."

obs_cluster.description: Name of the .obs key under which to add the cluster labels.

leiden_resolution.description: Control the coarseness of the clustering. Higher values lead to more clusters.

obsm_umap.description: In which .obsm slot to store the resulting UMAP embedding.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

param_list.description: Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel. A `param_list` can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml blob.
param_list.help_text:
Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel. A `param_list` can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml blob.

* A list of maps (as-is) where the keys of each map corresponds to the arguments of the pipeline. Example: in a `nextflow.config` file: `param_list: [ ['id': 'foo', 'input': 'foo.txt'], ['id': 'bar', 'input': 'bar.txt'] ]`.
* A csv file should have column names which correspond to the different arguments of this pipeline. Example: `--param_list data.csv` with columns `id,input`.
* A json or a yaml file should be a list of maps, each of which has keys corresponding to the arguments of the pipeline. Example: `--param_list data.json` with contents `[ {'id': 'foo', 'input': 'foo.txt'}, {'id': 'bar', 'input': 'bar.txt'} ]`.
* A yaml blob can also be passed directly as a string. Example: `--param_list "[ {'id': 'foo', 'input': 'foo.txt'}, {'id': 'bar', 'input': 'bar.txt'} ]"`.

When passing a csv, json or yaml file, relative path names are relativized to the location of the parameter file. No relativation is performed when `param_list` is a list of maps (as-is) or a yaml blob.
